overview_of_class: COURSE DESCRIPTION / Applications of optimized methods to the analysis, design and operation of transportation and logistical networks.  Flow prediction in congested multicommodity networks.  Vehicle routing and fleet management.  Application of inventory and queueing theories to the design and analysis of transport facilities.
name: Transportation Systems Analysis 1
title: MEAS CIV_ENV 471-1-20 Transportation Systems Analysis 1

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: COURSE DESCRIPTION / Applications of optimized methods to the analysis, design and operation of transportation and logistical networks. Flow prediction in congested multicommodity networks. Vehicle routing and fleet management. Application of inventory and queueing theories to the design and analysis of transport facilities.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value:
? understanding the concept of equilibrium and its role in transportation systems analysis;
? becoming familiar with formulations, analytical properties and solution algorithms of classical
network models that arise from transportation applications;
? being able to formulate, analyze and solve real-world transportation problems using the
network analysis tools learned in this course; and
? developing basic computer programming skills that serve a foundation for students who
wish to pursue more advanced courses and/or conduct independent research in related
fields.
